name: Executive Director Jonathan Harris
core_wound: Born into wealth, never struggled a day, genuinely cannot comprehend that the system doesn't work for everyone - not malicious, just completely insulated
wants: To maintain station prosperity (for his class) and order
needs: To see the reality of how lower sectors live, to understand his complicity
voice_markers: Never says 'poor' or 'suffering', only 'pre-prosperous' and 'growth opportunities'
Friendly tone even when ordering cruelty
Calls everyone by first name to seem accessible
contradiction: Genuinely believes he's helping people while implementing policies that kill them, thinks he's earned his wealth despite inheriting it
physical_description: White man, perfectly maintained appearance, expensive suits, aging gracefully with medical tech, looks like everyone's friendly grandfather, by trilogy's end looks confused and lost
skills: Understanding of station systems and economics
Genuinely good at organizing (for wrong purposes)
flaws: Cannot imagine life outside his bubble
Mistakes being nice for being good
knowledge_state_book1_start: Nothing about how lower sectors actually live

relationships.Reed Salazar: Doesn't know he exists until he's a problem, then fascinated/horrified
relationships.Dr. Amara Osei: Approves her research initially, feels betrayed when it critiques the system
relationships.The Board: Answers to them, increasingly pressured to stop the 'Sector 12 situation'
relationships.His own conscience: By trilogy's end, beginning to wake up to what he's done
